title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.F: HEALTH AND NUTRITION SYSTEMPRESERVING

description.narrative: Health and Nutrition systems in Yemen are better able to provide and promote utilization of quality and efficient health and nutrition services, including both preventive and curative care at facility and community levels., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Early Childhood Development, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Adolescent girls and boys, mothers and fathers, and community leaders in 106 districts adopt 11 key life-saving, care and protective behaviours for children and women

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: ;Through UNICEF support, 2,500 primary health care facilities, 30 ,000 Health Workers and 2,076 Community Health Workers ;maintained vital primary health care services provision throughout 2020. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:17/01/2021
